title: Tencent, the discreet Chinese digital leader, forced to reinvent itself
description: The Chinese company – founder of WeChat and world's No. 1 in video games – is selling off important assets. It's a turning point marking entry into a more manageable era for the web giant.

title: Prosecutors open investigation into US Rep.-Elect George Santos after he admits to numerous lies
description: After 'The New York Times'' revelations about a list of lies and some other lingering questions about his finances, Mr. Santos has shown no signs of stepping aside. He is scheduled to be sworn in on Tuesday.

title: In the US, Southwest Airlines flight cancellations continue to snowball
description: Thousands of flights are canceled because of a combination of factors including an antiquated crew-scheduling system. The federal government is now investigating.

title: After Japan and Italy, the US will require negative Covid tests for travelers from China
description: US health officials say that Beijing is not sharing enough information about the recent rapid surge in coronavirus cases. Starting January 5, all air passengers from China two and years older will need a negative test, regardless of their nationality.

title: Tension soars as main Kosovo border crossing with Serbia closed
description: The December 10 arrest of former Kosovo Serb police officer Dejan Pantic led to protests by Kosovo Serbs who erected multiple roadblocks in the north of the country.

title: The United Cup, a new mixed event to launch the 2023 tennis season
description: Starting Thursday, the Australian cities of Brisbane, Perth and Sydney will host the first edition of the United Cup, a mixed team competition that brings together eighteen countries.

title: How Starlink's satellite constellations are changing war
description: 'Race to the Stars' (3/4). In Ukraine, Elon Musk's satellite internet access service has kept Kyiv's troops connected. The efficient tool is forcing Europe to speed up its own constellation project.

title: Droughts in Eastern and Southern Africa threaten the power grid
description: Every day, electricity is cut off for several hours in Tanzania, Zimbabwe and Zambia due to low water levels in hydraulic dams.

title: China is wary of Starlink, but has other priorities
description: Built upon the control of information, the Chinese regime perceives Elon Musk's satellite constellation as a threat. Beijing's ambition is to 'access all space' within a radius of 60 to 100 times the distance between the Earth and the Sun.

title: In Ukraine, the resilience of video game creators
description: While the mainstream Ukrainian video game industry has adapted to the upheavals brought about by the Russian invasion, independent and amateur creators have not given up and are now addressing the war through their creations.

title: Paris-New York, Washington-Kabul in less than an hour: SpaceX's other military and commercial dream
description: Elon Musk's space company believes it can use its rockets to transport passengers, soldiers or military equipment on Earth.

title: Volunteers offer crucial help to Ukrainian military
description: The mayor of Ivano-Frankivsk, in western Ukraine, claims 11,000 citizens from his region have signed up to fight in Donbas, on the other side of the country.

title: Venezuelan opposition puts end to Juan Guaido's 'mandate'
description: Self-proclaimed 'interim president' in 2019, the former head of parliament supported by the US and its allies, including France, never managed to impose himself against Nicolas Maduro.

title: Ligue 1: PSG return to the pitch after World Cup showcase
description: Paris Saint-Germain plays Strasbourg on Wednesday, December 28. The return of league club will be a challenge for the club, given that 11 players went to the World Cup, including the starts Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappé.

title: Italy makes Covid test mandatory for China arrivals
description: As the number of cases explodes in China, Italy is introducing screening on all visitors arriving from China.

title: Ukrainian tycoon arrested in French ski resort in embezzlement probe
description: Kostiantyn Zhevago was arrested and will appear in court as part of an extradition process. He is accused of embezzling $100 million from a bank.

title: Mergers & acquisitions: After a sluggish 2022, investment bankers are cautious
description: Global transactions fell by nearly 39% in 2022, according to Dealogic. Inflation and the resulting rise in rates have signaled the end of easy money.

title: Republican representative-elect George Santos in hot water for embellishing bio
description: He claimed to be the embodiment of the American dream but lied about his education, religion and career.

title: Turkey: Forced marriage of six-year-old girl revives debate on religious sects
description: Revelations by daily newspaper 'Birgün' raise questions over the impunity enjoyed by religious brotherhoods close to the government.

title: Ligue 1: 'The risk is that players pick up too quickly after the World Cup'
description: James Bunce, AS Monaco's director of performance, discusses how to manage the return of international players who participated in the World Cup in Qatar, as the French league returns to action on Wednesday.

title: French defense minister visits Ukraine for first time since conflict began
description: France hosted an international conference on December 13 in support of Ukraine, insisting that it remains ready to provide all its humanitarian and military support to authorities in Kyiv.

title: With 'Strange World', Disney has not overexerted itself for Christmas
description: Full of very contemporary sincerity and educational messages, the sci-fi story does not add anything to the illustrious roster of the House of Mouse.

title: Israel: Netanyahu government makes West Bank settlements top priority
description: Benjamin Netanyahu's new government will be sworn in on Thursday. For the first time in the history of Israel, the cabinet will be exclusively formed by right-wing parties.

title: In Georgia, Russian exiles write to political prisoners at home: 'I regret not believing you'
description: This practice began due to the arrival of a flood of Russians fleeing the war in Ukraine and military mobilization.

title: The decline of the WTO, a threat to global stability
description: The World Trade Organization's key role in the coordination of world trade is being increasingly questioned. This is a dangerous slope, which risks leading to the primacy of the law of the strongest, at the worst possible time.

title: Former Nazi camp secretary, 97, appeals conviction for complicity in 10,000 murders
description: Convicted of being part of the apparatus that helped the Nazis' Stutthof concentration camp function, Irmgard Furchner said she was 'sorry for everything that happened.'

title: Ligue 1: Morocco's World Cup heroes Ounahi and Boufal are tempted to leave Angers
description: Angers SCO, who are last in the France league, is bracing for the departure of its two attacking midfielders.

title: 'The problem of universalism is not the failure of freedom and democratic values, is the failure to implement them'
description: Authoritarian regimes have enjoyed momentum since the beginning of the 21st century. But those who fight them share the same ideals. It is up to Europe to modernize them.

title: Pope Francis says former Pope Benedict is 'very ill', asks for prayers
description: 95-year-old Benedict has become increasingly frail in recent years as he dedicates his post-papacy life to prayer and meditation.

title: US winter storm Elliott's death toll continues to rise
description: More than half of the victims died in Buffalo, New York, where the blizzard was more intense than the one that hit the city in 1977.

title: Ligue 1: Boxing Day, an imported English tradition, divides French football
description: After the World Cup, the French league returns on Wednesday, December 28, playing matches during the festive period for the first time.

title: Russia bans oil sales to entities imposing price caps
description: This measure, which is in retaliation for Western sanctions, will take effect on February 1, 2023.

title: Vladimir Putin, the lord of the rings
description: As part of the meeting of the leaders of the Commonwealth of Independent States, a group of former Soviet Republics, the Kremlin chief offered eight rings to his guests and reserved the ninth for himself.

title: US weighs new measures for travelers coming from China
description: According to US officials, Washington is considering taking new coronavirus precautions for people traveling from China, following Beijing's rapid rise in infections as officials lift Covid Zero restrictions.

title: Origin of SARS-CoV-2: The search continues
description: Two main hypotheses behind the emergence of the virus in China remain on the table. Scientists are still on the hunt.

title: Bulgaria in shock after baby swap in maternity ward
description: The event reportedly occurred in the nursery where newborns are almost always placed right after their birth. The public prosecutor's office in Sofia has opened an investigation.

title: 'Potato growing regions see fewer battles in wars'
description: The introduction of the potato to Europe in the 17th century limited wars in the regions involved, writes economist Pauline Grosjean in her column.

title: In Hungary, a high school student spits her slam in Viktor Orban's face
description: Lili Pankotai, 18, angered the Hungarian prime minister's supporters with a poem spoken during a major demonstration in Budapest. In the now iconic text, she expresses the anger of young people against the education system controlled by the government.

title: The gaping wounds of Mayotte: 'We are not French, here'
description: Facing endemic poverty, a burgeoning population, and a struggling education system, the French island in the Indian Ocean is experiencing repeated social crises and high crim rates.

title: Quebec opts out of oath to King Charles III
description: The rebellion led by Quebec Members of the National Assembly (MNAs) could be followed by the rest of Canada – and other Commonwealth countries.

title: Donald Trump's tax returns rumored to be released on Friday
description: A congressional aide who spoke on condition of anonymity declared on Tuesday, December 27, Donald Trump's tax documents should be released during the next House meeting. The Internal Revenue Service had started auditioning the former president back in 2016.
